meanings.sent1: At the fancy event, all the gentlemen wore tuxes.
meanings.sent2: She rented two tuxes for the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The penguins looked hilarious in their tiny tuxes.
meanings.sent4: The sea lion joked that he needed a tux to fit in with the tuxes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the penguin waddling in its tux was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Tuxes: third person singular present of tuxedo
meanings.sent1: He always tuxes up for formal occasions.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity tuxes to impress the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it tuxes better than anyone else.
meanings.sent4: The moon tuxes itself in a silver glow at night.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a talking tux that tuxes itself is quite amusing.
